title: Tyler deserves his Indefinite-ban.
body:
The dude had a crap ton of accounts perma banned, he had *dozens* of chances. I'm sorry but maybe he should have reformed after the FIRST BAN?

Riot gave him chances, *a lot*, the guy wasn't just being a complete douche, he publicly showed it off like it was amusing.

Being a dick head for so long and all of a sudden being like "I'm reforming after years of a complete douche!" isn't going to cut. I'm happy Riot banned him forever.

replies.body: What people fail to realize is when 5k people are watching a stream someone could think that Riot is okay with that behavior. Honestly any streamer that is breaking the ToS over and over again should be perma banned like Tyler.
soooo... 90 percent of girl streamers? oh wait, riot doesnt care haha!!!!
The streamers you're talking about haven't had 19 perma banned accounts.

but they have ruined about 200 league ranked games. id say thats more than tylers running it down mid meta.

try watching kaceytron play and tell me how long she actually users he champion for.
Tylers been running it down mid for 5 years.
Kaceytron has been intent deranking ranked games for a few years now, as long as i can remember lol.
But she is doing it in Bronze 5, not Plat+, so Riot doesn't care
Kaceytron is like bronze 5. There are so many trolls down in that pit she probably looks like a saint.
that doesnt excuse her tho. this entire game is filled with trolls, tyler 1 does it if hes pissed off. others do it nonstop just for the fun of it. is he a saint then?

How do you not understand 15+ banned accounts vs 0? (I'm assuming she hasn't been banned I don't actually know)... people don't report Kaceytron because they don't know she is trolling. They just think she is terrible at the game.... (which she is)
He should've been indefinitely ban BEFORE he even reformed. Now that he did reform and was improving everyday, it appears to be a huge injustice.
because riot doesn't give a shit

There are 2nd chances.

And then there's 19 chances.

But 20th time's the charm. Give him another chance, m8. Everyone's entitled to 19 repeat offenses before they learn their lesson.
Its funny because he actually had 76 chances. There is a 4 stage warning system before each ban.

Kaceytron afks 5 minute to read donations everygame: Its k
Tyler is an arrogant douche on Twitch, but stays clean ingame: Its not k

-Rito

He wasn't clean in game...He intentionally fed, he trolled, he cursed/insulted, he threatened people, and even tried to threaten to troll the match right in front of Phreak before crying his eyes out after someone dodged.
ayyy didn't see that one, when did it happen?

> [{quoted}](name=Galacticamaru,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cMY4mTOG,comment-id=000c00000000,timestamp=2016-04-30T15:30:06.588+0000)
>
> ayyy didn't see that one, when did it happen?

Didnt he have an "int list" where if he sees a summoner that is on his list, He'll time "int" into chat to either make that person dodge the game or he will feed?
Omg he did! I didn'r remember that one.

its a video game. this game specifically is becoming more and more harsh to toxic players. idc if someone tells me to kms or get cancer. im old enough to not care. all video games have trash talking and trolling. this guy got trolled multiple times and didnt cry or whine. but when he does it the world is over.

"its a video game" yes but you are interacting with others, idc on what game/social/whatever. You don't act like an asshole to someone, what the hell is wrong with people in this world thinkings it *OK* to be a douche?
its not ok, but it happens. theres a mute button. if you dont use it and instead whine about cyberbullying,then you're wasting everyones time for no reason.

I'm not whining, I muted , and reported the kid. Tyler1 deserved what he got, be a douche, you get banned, be a douche on 20 accounts and get perma banned 20 times, then you don't belong in this community ever.

http://i.imgur.com/W0wVY4c.gif?Noredirect

Honestly I have no idea what happen but from what I can gather someone got permabanned and everyone is hating on it.
Quite frankly if you get permabanned a second time then just gtfo we don't need your trash here take it to like Smite or something.

Oh look, a post that rides Riots dick about a decision among the streaming community. Posted 8 hours ago and only 25 upvotes? Noone cares about you and your opinion. Everyone disagrees with riot and some little kid like you trying to stand up for them is doing nothing. Riot made a mistake and stop trying to get free skins scrub.
Oh the irony in this comment.
You sure are one edgy dude. Be sure you don't cut yourself.
You okay dude? Seems like you're having a mental breakdown.

now you're telling me im mentally unstable?????? holy fuck gota report you to riot support because this is too much for me. RIOTTTTTTTTT SMITE THIS GUYYYYY IM APOSITIVE PLAYER THIS CANT HAPPEN TO ME!!!!!!!! AHHH TOXIC PEOPLE ARE CYBER BULLYING ME!!

thsi game is a joke and always will be. take me back to s3 when saying you suck wasnt toxic to people whose balls have actually dropped.
We had a very similar system in S3. The Tribunal was actually much tougher on players if you were indeed toxic.

actually i was incredibly toxic back in s3 and didnt get banned. i wish i had taken advantage and instead of being super toxic said "get good' when someone was playing poorly. now its if riot notices someones feelings are hurt they will instantly punish him rather than separate the 10 year old churchboys from people who actually enjoy winning.

also instead of downvoting me, can you spend more time in putting quality in your replies? thanks!

I haven't downvoted any of your comments. 

People can be mildly toxic and not get banned. Streamers like N3ac3y are somewhat toxic in chat, but they aren't toxic to the point of Tyler1. Riot is okay with you being slightly toxic to your teammates. If they feel comfortable with how they were treated in game you're 100% safe. People will only stay after and report you if you made them feel like shit, or if they felt great playing with you.
then me never wishing deathon people or telling them to kil themselves doesnt warrant 2 perma banns because i occasionally tell people to shut the fuck up if they irritate me?

Or how about you dont tell people to shut the fuck up because thats rude? Did your parents ever teach you to not be a dick to others? Is this not common sense and manners?

Theres a kid in my school whos annoying as shit, in my school, says stupid shit and is just really dumb. I don't tell the kid to shut the fuck up. Why? Cause I'm not a dick.
rude? are we in fucking church? me being a dick is not telling someone to shut the fuck up. loosen your fucking panties.

No we are not in church, Idk what the hell that has to do with anything. Telling someone to shut the fuck up is rude and disrespectful. Do you have no sense of manners? Were you not taught to be respectful of others?

Do you have no respect for others AzureRaven?
respect? if someone trolls or insutls me im going to tell him to shut the flying fuck up. if thats rule-breaking then so fucking be it. but its a JOKE.
No if someone trolls or insults you, you mute them, report and move on. Two wrongs don't make a right.
or because you cant stand up for yourself

I agree. I read the post, and, even though it has 1.4k downvotes (currently, and probably increasing as I type), I think Tyler deserves it based on the info availible. If he has *that many* permabanned accounts that Riot actually *notices*, that's a lot of BS going on. Odds are, if Riot actually noticed, "Hey, this guy has had several accounts all permabanned for similar reasons, and he's kind of an asshole," I personally don't want this guy to keep coming back to the community and being a nuisance.

I agree.
It probably has so many down votes cause his fanboys come over here just to downvote the thread XD

The reaction of the people in the Tyler1 ban post has nothing to do with Tyler1. It is the way Riot is trying to solve it.

A ban on sight does not prevent him from playing. It does prevent him from streaming. In fact Tyler1 has been banned on sight because he was streaming. 

High elo is just toxic. Tyler1 is just a bit more toxic. The issue that high elo is toxic stays.

Tyler1 can still play. Riot didn't got our back. They just try to convince us that they are listening... nice try tho.

I know a high master tier player and he's the nicest person you will ever meet. He hasnt EVEN ONCE insulted someone.

You are in charge of yourself not others. Don't blame it on the elo blame it on the person.

I know that there are players in high elo which are not toxic but they are rare. The problem with high elo is that people take the game much more serious then in low elo and they argue about mistakes much more. The tendency to get toxic in high elo is much bigger then in low elo and this has nothing to do with league of legends. This is in every multiplayer competitive game the case. 

So, yes I still blame it on the elo. 

In my opinion Riot mixed up the two things. A toxic player who is streaming and a toxic player who is not streaming, is for the people who play the game  the same problem. They only made this statement to prevent Tyler1 from streaming while they can't handle the problem itself... but they try to make us believe that they can handle the problem. And this is why I downvote.

How do you fix what cant be fixed?

There's so many immature people in high elo because people don't spank their kids anymore.

Riot would literally have to change the family dynamic in america and make sure kids are properly taught manners in order to clean up high elo toxicity.

The reason my freinds doesn't rage or troll is because he was raised properly. There's zero things riot cam do to help.

Then maybe they write this instead of "we got your back, issue solved, move on". They could also write that they ban Tyler1 on sight for streaming the game. Everything would make sense. Upvote. 

But instead it is a typical Riot post to make us believe that they care about players feedback while they really don't.

Wait... you would rather them go.

"EH we can't fix the problem so we are just going to completely ignore"

They do care about player feedback. It's just they don't and CANT listen to 100% of feedback.

Because some people want stricter rules and other want to be able to do death threats with no backlash.

They don't care about player feedback. They only care about their game and their reputation. If a player like Tyler1 makes fun out of their game with streaming then they immediatly ban him on sight. If a player makes fun out of you they really don't give a fk. 

They have no sense about sports and rules.. they only have a sense for money.
